skill.name: biorxiv-database
skill.description: Efficient database search tool for bioRxiv preprint server. Use this skill when searching for life sciences preprints by keywords, authors, date ranges, or categories, retrieving paper metadata, downloading PDFs, or conducting literature reviews.

skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No data theft or malicious execution patterns were found. Network use is limited to bioRxiv API and PDF endpoints consistent with the stated purpose.

content.value_statement: Finding relevant life science preprints can be slow and inconsistent. This skill searches bioRxiv with filters and returns structured metadata and PDFs.
actual_capabilities: Search preprints by date range and optional category filter
Search by author name within a date range
Search by keywords across title, abstract, or authors
Retrieve detailed metadata for a specific DOI
Download a paper PDF by DOI
limitations: Keyword search in the CLI requires a start date or days back
PDF downloads always use version v1 in the URL
No automatic pagination for large result sets
Requires network access to the bioRxiv API

use_cases.title: Start a literature scan
use_cases.description: Find recent preprints in a field and export results for review.

use_cases.title: Track author outputs
use_cases.description: Monitor new preprints from specific researchers over time.

use_cases.title: Build datasets
use_cases.description: Pull metadata and PDFs for downstream analysis pipelines.

prompt_templates.title: Find recent papers
prompt_templates.prompt: Search bioRxiv for keyword CRISPR in the last 30 days and save results to results.json.

prompt_templates.title: Author scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Find bioRxiv papers by author Johnson from 2023-01-01 to 2024-12-31 and summarize counts.

prompt_templates.title: Category focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for deep learning in neuroscience from 2024-01-01 to 2024-06-30 and list top 10 titles.

prompt_templates.title: Download PDFs
prompt_templates.prompt: Get details for DOI 10.1101/2024.01.15.123456 and download the PDF to papers/123456.pdf.

output_examples.input: Find genomics preprints from June 2024 and summarize the top results
output: Top titles include advances in genome editing and long read assembly
Saved full metadata with DOI, authors, and links for each paper

best_practices: Use narrow date ranges for faster responses
Add category filters to improve relevance
Cache JSON outputs to avoid repeat API calls
anti_patterns: Running large date ranges without limits
Using keyword search without a start date
Assuming PDF version numbers without checking metadata

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is a Python script usable in all three environments.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: The API rate limits requests and large ranges can return many results.

faq.question: How do I integrate results with other tools?
faq.answer: Export JSON and load it into analysis tools like pandas or CSV.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No, it only calls bioRxiv endpoints and writes files you specify.

faq.question: What if I get no results?
faq.answer: Check date ranges, category spelling, and try broader keywords.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual search?
faq.answer: It automates queries, exports structured metadata, and supports batch workflows.
